content: I've spent a lot of time soul searching about what I want Junk Muffler to be. I have some thoughts that I'm ready to share with everyone now.
title: Changes Are Afoot - Temporary Hiatus and a New Direction

content: Hey Junkyard Dogs! Things are going to be quiet for a bit. This is partially for personal reasons, and partially because I want to take Junk Muffler in a different direction. This means my posts are going to be even less frequent than normal for a while. I‚Äôm not done. I didn‚Äôt quit. I have a clear vision for the future of JM. Sigh‚Ä¶ Let me just tell you what‚Äôs going on.
title: Changes Are Afoot - Temporary Hiatus and a New Direction

content: The (Boring) Personal Stuff I‚Äôm moving across the country to another state. Mrs. Muffler and I have moved around a lot, but this is by far the biggest move we‚Äôve ever undertaken. It‚Äôs stressful, there‚Äôs a lot of uncertainty, and we‚Äôre both somewhat terrified. It will be worth it once we‚Äôre done. This has been a dream of ours forever. I‚Äôm excited about it. I‚Äôm also completely stressed out. On top of that, I‚Äôve really struggled to ‚Äúfeel funny‚Äù for quite a while. Even my last few tracks felt ‚Äúehhhhh‚Äù. I kinda regret putting them out. My headspace has been a problem for as long as I can remember. I finally went and got help for it. It turns out crippling anxiety isn‚Äôt normal. Who knew? My only regret was not getting help sooner. We need to normalize talking about mental health.
title: Changes Are Afoot - Temporary Hiatus and a New Direction

content: The Future of Junk Muffler This is what I‚Äôm super excited about. :) First, I‚Äôve realized that trying to force myself to be funny has really crippled my creative output. Instead of being funny, I want to be honest and authentic. That means some songs may be funny, others might not. It depends on how I feel at the moment. My two favorite songs are King Neptune and Grandma‚Äôs Got a Crush on the Weatherman. Neither one are necessarily trying to be funny. They‚Äôre honest though, and they fit my personal aesthetic. I want to make more stuff like that. I also want to do more than make music. I‚Äôm interested in other things like small electronics, 3D printing, improv comedy, and all the typical nerd stuff. I want to bring those aspects of my life into Junk Muffler as well. For example‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm really interested in hardware synthesizers. I‚Äôve thought about buying one, but they‚Äôre super expensive. There‚Äôs plenty of resources online for designing and building you‚Äôre own though. I‚Äôd like to try that out and bring you along for the journey. Junk Muffler will always be about music, but I want to do other stuff too. I‚Äôm excited about the projects I have planned and the road ahead. I hope you‚Äôll join me for the ride.
title: Changes Are Afoot - Temporary Hiatus and a New Direction

content: I wanted to write a Christmas song with timeless advice that would transcend the ages. After much soul searching, I think I finally found something.
title: Warning Bells

content: When I was a strapping young lad during the early days of the internet, there was an incredible flash game called Don‚Äôt Sh*t Your Pants. The significance of this game on my life cannot be overstated. It altered the course of history. This song is an attempt to take the life lessons learned from this 90‚Äôs flash game and package it up for you in a festive musical fashion. I‚Äôd love to say my comedic sensibilities of matured since the 90‚Äôs, but you‚Äôre here and therefore have likely encountered my music. You know I haven‚Äôt matured a single bit. As we roll up on the new year, there‚Äôs a lot I realize I want to accomplish in 2022. I want Junk Muffler to become a thing‚Ä¶ Not neccessarily something that makes money. I don‚Äôt want my hobby to become a victim of late stage capitalism. Just‚Ä¶ A thing that brings joy to the world. If you‚Äôre reading this, I hope my music has brought joy to you. Merry Christmas and I‚Äôll see you next year. :)
title: Warning Bells

content: What does Santa do to unwind after a stressful night of delivering toys all over the world? Here's a song about the north pole after party.
title: Twelve Twenty-Six

content: As a kid I never believed in Santa Claus. I grew up super poor. My parents wanted to make for darn sure I knew they bought every gift. I don‚Äôt blame them. The alternative is believing Santa loves rich kids more. As an adult I‚Äôve grown increasingly cynical of Christmas. Not the spirit of it so much. More the execution. I don‚Äôt understand why showing each other we care has to manifest itself in consumerism. I‚Äôm a grown man. I‚Äôll buy my own synthesizer if I want one. Heck, I might just go and build one. I do like the idea of Santa being real though and being‚Ä¶ Perhaps a little different than what we imagine. If Santa were to let loose and be‚Ä¶ gasp human? What would that look like? Would he get burned out? Would he spend hours on the phone arguing over Playstation 5 supply issues? Would, maybe, one year the world get to him and he just give up? I dunno‚Ä¶ This is getting way too deep. Go buy some crap for others. Hope others give you the crap you wanted. Merry Christmas.
title: Twelve Twenty-Six

content: Is this song a fart joke or a poop joke? It's a little of both. As a man who's on the wrong side of 35 I've learned to be very, very careful...
title: Danger is Subjective

content: Oh fart jokes‚Ä¶ You never get old. One day I fear my inner 11-year-old will die and fart jokes will cease to be funny. Fortunately that has yet to be the case. This is much to the chagrin of Mrs. Muffler. Fart jokes, it seems, are eternal. Most of my songs are based on real life. I assure you that I did not sh*t my pants in the middle of a Walmart. There‚Äôs no way I would do something like that. Nope. Nuh-uh. Not me. You won‚Äôt see me on ‚ÄúPeople of Walmart‚Äù any time soon. It was Target. Unfortunately ‚ÄúTarget‚Äù doesn‚Äôt rhyme with ‚ÄúFart‚Äù. ü§∑ There‚Äôs a part of me that thinks I should give up comedy. Like honestly? I kind of feel like this video is scraping the bottom of the comedy barrel. Maybe I should try to make real music. But this? This is me. For better or worse. Everyone says they don‚Äôt care what people think of them‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs a lie. Everyone is continually obsessed with what other people think of them. It never ends. It starts in Kindergarten and continues until the day we die. The closest thing you‚Äôll find to someone who is free of this is an artist. It takes absolute guts of steel to put your art out into the world. You have to be prepared for people to criticize you who would never have the courage to be so vulnerable in public. And yes‚Ä¶ I do consider what I do to be art. Perhaps it‚Äôs not high-brow art. It‚Äôs never going to be considered on par with Mozart, but it‚Äôs the art that inside my heart. Cringey? Absolutely‚Ä¶ But at the end of the day I just want to make you laugh, man‚Ä¶ Anyway, that‚Äôs enough introspection. I recognize this video is freaking terrible. Thanks for watching anyway.
title: Danger is Subjective

content: Thanksgiving is a time for family, gratitude, and getting a giant 60" television for the cheapest price possible. Here's a song to celebrate the day.
title: The Thanksgiving Song

content: Has it seriously been eight months since I released a song? That doesn‚Äôt seem to be right, but here we are. The YouTube timestamps don‚Äôt lie. Wow‚Ä¶ To be fair, a lot of stuff has happened in my life. I‚Äôll hopefully share more about it soon. I may make the musical equivelant of candy corn, but I bust my butt on every song. It takes a lot out of me, even though I love it. And honestly? The past eight months I haven‚Äôt had a lot to give. None of that though‚Ä¶ Right now? I want to show gratitude. I‚Äôm thankful that despite all the stuff I‚Äôve been through, I‚Äôve come through relatively intact. In many ways, maybe a bit better. The holidays matter to me in ways that I can‚Äôt quite describe. For years I refused to leave the house on Christmas. Thanksgiving and Christmas were the two times a year everyone had to be nice to each other. As I got older that changed due to circumstance. My low point was spending Thanksgiving at a Denny‚Äôs. I almost made that the song, but the memory was a little too depressing. I‚Äôve come to realize that the things that are special in this world are the things we take the time to make special. The holidays matter because we choose for them to matter. Anyway‚Ä¶ Happy Thanksgiving y‚Äôall. Muffler out. :)
title: The Thanksgiving Song

content: The ongoing GPU shortage is annoying for everyone. Here's a song about when I waited at Microcenter for 15 hours in the freezing cold for a 3080.
title: Frames Win Games

content: I love video games. The problem is I profoundly suck at them. Except for Mario Kart. I‚Äôm fairly competent at Mario Kart. :) I didn‚Äôt play a lot games as a kid. Every year I‚Äôd beg for a Nintendo. Eventually I was given an old school gray and white Game Boy. I loved that thing. I only had a few games for it. One of them was Tiny Toon Adventures: Bab‚Äôs Big Break. It wasn‚Äôt a particularly great game, but 8 year old me was obsessed with it. When I was a senior in high school I got an original Xbox and played the heck out of Halo. It was amazing until I started playing online. The skill gap between me and even other n00bs was so great that I just died every few seconds. That wasn‚Äôt fun. So today I tend to steer away from highly competitive games. Instead I love RPG‚Äôs, indies, and other artisticly done games. I also enjoy playing cooperative games with my friends. I‚Äôve had a blast with Deep Rock Galactic, Phantasy Star Online 2, and other stuff of that nature. Weirdly there was a time in my life where I thought I wanted to be a game developer. My life took a different turn, but perhaps I‚Äôll return to that someday. It‚Äôs simultaneously easier and harder to get into now. I have a long history of waiting in line for stuff. I waited in line for 14 hours with my mother for an Xbox 360. I waited 12 hours for an iPhone 3g once. There‚Äôs a great line from the ‚ÄúHitchikers Guide to the Galaxy‚Äù movie with Arthur Dent says ‚ÄúI‚Äôm British‚Ä¶ I know how to queue!‚Äù I feel like I can relate. Except I‚Äôm not British‚Ä¶ Though you wouldn‚Äôt guess it from the amount of tea I drink. Anyway, thanks as always for listening to my stuff. Until next time, like and subscribe y‚Äôall‚Ä¶ Like and subscribe.
title: Frames Win Games

content: I'm so excited to release my first album! Like and Subscribe Junk Muffler Vol.1 is available on all major streaming services now!
title: Like and Subscribe: Junk Muffler Vol. 1

content: I‚Äôm super-hype to announce the first Junk Muffler album ever! Hopefully it‚Äôs the first of many more to come. It took me a long time to come up with a collection I was happy with. I hope you enjoy listening to it as much as I enjoyed creating it. You can find it on all major streaming services. Find yours on the list below and use the link to start blasting this through your headphones! Spotify Apple Music / iTunes YouTube Music Amazon Music Bandcamp SoundCloud You can also find the songs on TikTok, Instagram, and Facebook. I just can‚Äôt link to them. But if you wanna twerk to a JM Jam? Be my guest. Thanks so much to all the folks who provided so much encouragement along the way! This album wouldn‚Äôt have been possible without you!
title: Like and Subscribe: Junk Muffler Vol. 1

content: 2020 was a rough year for everyone. I wrote this song about all of my favorite things. This is what I think about at night to calm myself down.
title: Counting Calories

content: Here‚Äôs a lullaby for all my fellow foodies. Also‚Ä¶ For anyone who managed to survive 2020. I feel like since March all anyone I know has done is sit and eat. I know I gained a bunch of pandemic weight that I‚Äôm working to get off. I will say that my weakness in breakfast food. In particular, I LOVE pancakes. Before the pandemic hit we did the ‚ÄúTour du Pancakes‚Äù where I ate at several local restaurants. I highly reccomend this experience. I hope to do round two once the pandemic ends. Alright, that wraps this one up. Thanks for listening to the song! Now go eat some pancakes and‚Ä¶ Like and subscribe y‚Äôall‚Ä¶ Like and subscribe‚Ä¶
title: Counting Calories

content: Every YouTuber has one goal in life... For you to Like and Subscribe. I'm so obsessed with this goal that I wrote a song about if for my listeners.
title: Like and Subscribe: The Musical!

content: I feel like subtlety is so undervalued in the music world. Like‚Ä¶ What is a song really about? What‚Äôs the artist‚Äôs core message? What do they want you to take away from the song? In case you missed it, the message of this song is to like and subscribe y‚Äôall‚Ä¶ Like and subscribe. Fun fact about how I make music‚Ä¶ The songs I make are usually driven by Music Weeklies. Each week they post a prompt. You have one week to make a song based off that prompt. I find this immensely useful. The prompt gets rid of ‚Äúblank page syndrome.‚Äù Having a starting point is frequently the hardest part. The deadline makes sure I actually get something accomplished. Otherwise I‚Äôd just sit down in front of my keyboard with a pack of Oreos and doomscroll TikTok‚Äôs instead of actually making music. Anyway, the prompt this week was ‚ÄúBroadway Musical‚Äù. I had NO idea how I was going to pull this off. I‚Äôve never written anything remotely ‚ÄúBroadway‚Äù before. I was stuck until I found a freaking amazing YouTube video. I‚Äôm going to be experimenting with other types of content soon. If you were wondering where the ‚Äúvlogs‚Äù I mentioned in the song are‚Ä¶ They‚Äôre coming. They just‚Ä¶ You know‚Ä¶ Haven‚Äôt actually been recorded yet. JM
title: Like and Subscribe: The Musical!

content: I wrote this song based on the true story of when I tried to microwave compost and eat it for lunch. Mrs. Muffler still laughs hard about it.
title: Compost Lunch

content: Mrs. Muffler‚Äôs Composting Isn‚Äôt All Bad I love to poke fun at Mrs. Muffler, but the truth is we should all be better to the environment. I‚Äôm more of a hippie than I let on. We‚Äôve both been proud vegetarians for over a decade. I believe the way we treat each other, our planet, and other species matters. I‚Äôll leave the matter there. I create comedy not commentary. Just know that we care. Profoundly. It‚Äôs interesting how folks seem to think all vegetarians eat is salad. Mrs. M is an amazing cook and can whip up some seriously badass food. At the risk of looking like a basic ‚ÄúInstagram-Bro‚Äù‚Ä¶ Here‚Äôs some pictures of food I recently ate. This is avocado toast with orzo chickpea salad. Yes, we love avocado toast. Don‚Äôt judge. That stuff is off the chain. The orzo salad is really good too. I love grabbing it for lunch because it‚Äôs delish, takes zero prep time, and isn‚Äôt easily mistaken for compost. Mrs. Muffler‚Äôs potato corn chowder soup is like nectar from the gods. She never makes it the same way twice, but it always ends up being delicious anyway. Even my father-in-law and brother-in-law, who are carnivores, love this stuff. My point is that my life isn‚Äôt all compost‚Ä¶ There‚Äôs some legitimate culinary amazingness happening‚Ä¶ As evidenced by my ever-expanding waste line. That‚Äôs it‚Äôs for now. Until next time‚Ä¶ Like and subscribe y‚Äôall‚Ä¶ Like & subscribe.
title: Compost Lunch

content: I wrote a song about the modern world's obsession with doom scrolling. What's my potato chip flavor? Who's my princess? Come inside to discover more.
title: Addicted to Doom

content: 13 Reasons You Should Like & Subscribe to Me on YouTube (#6 will SHOCK YOU!) Someday I hope to get a recording of one of Mrs. Muffler‚Äôs legendary house-shaking farts and sample it into a song. It‚Äôs proven* that folks who Like & Subscribe to Junk Muffler are on average 37% sexier. I have some new types of content planned in addition to the songs I put out. Be the first to see what‚Äôs new in the Mufflerverse! Every time someone Likes and Subscribes I give my dogs another biscuit! Pampered pooch‚Äôs are relying on your generosity! I dunno if it‚Äôs true or not, but I heard a rumor the last guy who Liked and Subscribed won $20 on a scratch off. Coincidence? I think not. I actually am planning something AMAZING for when I hit 100 subscribers‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs too early to talk about it, but I‚Äôve never seen another YouTuber do anything similar‚Ä¶ If you‚Äôre willing to take a chance on me right now? That means a lot to me. I am an extremely cheap person. All my socks have holes and I‚Äôm too cheap to replace them. I‚Äôve promised Mrs. Muffler that every time someone Likes and Subscribes I‚Äôll throw away one holy sock! I‚Äôm really, really close to releasing an album. Subscribers will know when it drops first! If you think my socks are bad, my underwear is worse. I‚Äôve promised Mrs. Muffler that when I hit 100 subscribers I‚Äôll throw out all my old underwear and buy new! As an artist it‚Äôs really hard to tell if you‚Äôre actually making stuff people like. When you Like & Subscribe it tells me that I‚Äôm on the right track. My ego is already the size of Manhatten. Every time someone subscribes it gets a bit bigger. We just don‚Äôt know how big it can get‚Ä¶ So subscribe! For science! I‚Äôve officially named my subscribers ‚ÄúJunkyard Dogs‚Äù‚Ä¶ If you ever wanted a profoundly cheesy nickname, here‚Äôs your chance! You‚Äôre clearly doomscrolling right now, so I mean‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs not like you have higher priorities at the moment‚Ä¶ *Totally not proven‚Ä¶ Yet‚Ä¶ On Princesses and Potato Chips Here‚Äôs a couple of the quizzes mentioned in the song: What‚Äôs Disney Princess are you? What‚Äôs your potato chip flavor? I‚Äôm kinda curious about your Disney Princess. Tell me what you got in the poll below.
title: Addicted to Doom

content: My grandmother was obsessed with our local TV weatherman. Here's a song about her crushing like a school girl on this poor dude.
title: Grandma's Got a Crush on the Weatherman

content: Fair warning‚Ä¶ This post is not funny. My initial goal was to write a rip-roaring follow-up to last week‚Äôs song about a haunted toilet. Instead we got this‚Ä¶ A song that is not without humor but also cut a vein deeper than I planned. During my formative years (12 - 18) if I wasn‚Äôt doing school work I was helping to care for my grandparents. My grandfather had an extended illness before passing. Every day we went over to his house so my mother could perform nursing duties (only with none of the training). After my grandpa passed we moved in with my grandmother. The alternative was putting her in a nursing home, a choice my mother was adamantly against. Whether that was the right decision or not is something I‚Äôm still not sure of to this day. What I will say is that elder care is not for the faint of heart. I understand that the conditions in many nursing homes are questionable. There comes a point though when you have to turn it over to professionals. Tending to my grandparents took its toll. The larger issue though is the eccentricities that come with age. Grandma was demanding, entitled, and difficult to live with. She was both an authority figure and someone who I had to care for. That led to many conflicts that didn‚Äôt end well for me. ‚Ä¶And yeah. Part of me resented the fact that I had to help take care of grandma. Especially while other boys were out going to parties, kissing girls, and ‚Äúcoming of age‚Äù. I had a girlfriend but we couldn‚Äôt hang out much. ‚ÄúHey girl, wanna come over and watch the weather with my Grandma?‚Äù That isn‚Äôt exactly the type of thing 16 year old Junk Muffler wanted ask. Of course I couldn‚Äôt go over to my girlfriend‚Äôs house because‚Ä¶ You know‚Ä¶ Grandma. Here‚Äôs the thing though‚Ä¶ I loved her. I still miss her. Inside of me is this duality where I have so many difficult memories of her, yet I still loved her. She cared a lot about me. I know that. I‚Äôll never forget that. This duality in my heart is something that will never go away. The song captures it, even though that wasn‚Äôt my intention. I‚Äôll try to be funny next time. Promise.
title: Grandma's Got a Crush on the Weatherman

content: John the Toilet Demon never actually wanted to be a jerk. While other demon spawn were kicking fireballs around the playground, John sat quietly in the corner reading a book. He never really fit in well with the others. During parent conferences his teachers expressed concern. John was far behind the other spawn. He was failing elementary pitchfork handling technique! What respectable demon couldn‚Äôt torture lost souls with a proper pitchfork? Sadly nobody was able to get through to him. When John hit adolescence he found, somewhere in the depths of Hell, an old Nintendo Entertainment System and a copy of Super Mario Bros. John was immediately entranced. Immediately he knew what he wanted with his life. Forget being an eternal torturer of lost souls. He wanted to be a flipping plumber. ‚Ä¶And so began John‚Äôs education. As he grew older he spent his days halfheartedly working his pain and torment internship. In the evenings he rushed home and watched plumbing videos on YouTube. He learned all the tricks of the trade‚Ä¶ How to angle the pipes just right to achieve the proper amount of flow. How to properly seal joins so water doesn‚Äôt leak and bubble up through the long-suffering homeowner‚Äôs floor. How to pick out the perfect pair of pants to show the maximum amount of butt crack when you bend over. Eventually John was no longer satisfied watching plumbers do it on the internet. He wanted to do it himself with some real pipes! So, John snuck out of Hell and ascended to the human world. His eyes burned white hot as he saw what he had longed for all his life. A real house with real plumbing. This was his chance! Immediately he inhabited the home‚Äôs plumbing system and explored it with all the ecstasy of a puppy who‚Äôs just discovered daddy‚Äôs expensive pair of brand-new Nike‚Äôs‚Ä¶ Satan, unfortunately, does enjoy being a jerk. When he discovered what John had done, he trapped him in the home‚Äôs plumbing for the remainder of eternity. John is now stuck looking at assholes all day and taking everyone‚Äôs crap. He‚Äôd actually be okay with this given that he‚Äôs surprisingly chill for a demon‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs just that his attempts at communicating with the humans have been tragically unsuccessful. The demonic tongue tends to inspire pure terror. Even if you‚Äôre just trying to say that the kitchen faucet is leaking more than you realize and should really be looked at, it just causes lots of wailing and screaming. ‚Ä¶And so John sits, lonely and forgotten. All he really wants is to be the world‚Äôs best plumber and find a Princess Peach of his own. Maybe knock out a few pirhanna plants for good measure. In recent years John has given up trying to communicate‚Ä¶ Wailing only one phrase in agony over and over again to any who would listen. He screams‚Ä¶ Like and subscribe y‚Äôall‚Ä¶ Like and subscribe‚Ä¶
title: The Haunted Toilet

content: Energy drink culture has always fascinated me. Like... What the heck is in this thing? Why are we drinking it? Does it actually provide energy?
title: Gamer Ooze Side Effects

content: Gamer Ooze side effects include uncontrollable flatulence, delusions of grandeur, out of body experiences, and an acute loss of sexual desirability. Many gamers experience excessive butt growth, increase in body stank, Dorito dust stains, and a substantial loss of social skills. Many individuals may experience glowing poop turds and blue urine. If you experience an erection for more than four hours after drinking Gamer Ooze please contact your doctor. In some cases Gamer Ooze has proven effective at growing hair in the nose, arm pit, and eyebrow regions of the body. Sadly, no correlation between hair growth on the scalp has been made. For individuals going through puberty, Gamer Ooze frequently increases irritability and agitation. Individuals may engage in loud rants about fornicating with other gamer‚Äôs mothers. Be assured that the likelihood of such fornication is in fact, quite low. In the event fornication does happen, Gamer Ooze accepts no responsibility. In all likelihood said fornication is the result of the two gallons of Axe Deodorant Body Spray the individual was wearing. Most individuals will experience some degree of light sensitivity after consuming Gamer Ooze. This is not a cause for concern. Continue gaming as planned in a darkened room with a bag of Doritos on hand. Try to not imagine what your non-gaming friends are doing right now‚Ä¶ Going to parties, drinking beer, getting laid‚Ä¶ You don‚Äôt need any of that. You have Gamer Ooze and‚Ä¶ The Game man‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs in the game‚Ä¶ In the event that more than 37 cans of Gamer Ooze are consumed in a 24 hour period, please contact poison control immediately. You will likely require hospitalization to prevent the effects of ‚ÄúThe Transition‚Äù. While most individuals find ‚ÄúThe Transition‚Äù to be intensely painful, a small subset of the population will find it to be pleasurable and a transcendental experience. There‚Äôs no way to know if this is you unless you try it, which we don‚Äôt actually recommend doing. If you do somehow survive ‚ÄúThe Transition‚Äù you will officially become a member of ‚ÄúThe Gooze Club‚Äù‚Ä¶ The primary benefits are a spiffy membership card and being allowed to refer to Gamer Ooze as ‚ÄúGooze‚Äù. Other standard side effects include mouth blisters, spontaneous combustion, nausea, diarrhea, bruising, yellow skin, blindness, hives, indigestion, genital itching, anxiety, low sperm count, shortness of breath, heart palpitations, delirium, intense thirst, increased urination, difficult urination, depression about the increased amount of difficult urination, gambling addiction, blood clots, and Gynophobia. Many individuals experience a relatively specific hallucination. It begins with the sensation of floating. Slowly you float upwards to the sky. First you are amongst the clouds, then you become the clouds. You are one with the sky and the sky is one with you. Then, the clouds are no more and you are standing before two identical doors. In this scenario always, always take the left door. We don‚Äôt actually know what‚Äôs behind the right door. Nobody has recovered enough to tell us. Regardless, after going through the left door you will be confronted with the abyss of space. Stare at it and let it stare back at you. Contemplate your existence as you experience your inner self expand past the limits of your body. Soon the abyss of space will fade away and you‚Äôll find yourself standing atop a mountain. An old man sitting beside a warm fire awaits you. You look into his eyes and realize that he has the answer to every question you‚Äôve ever wanted to know‚Ä¶ Was the mechanical pony really broken when you were eight? Or did your dad say the fat kids broke it because he didn‚Äôt want to dig a quarter out of his pocker? Who really did frame Roger Rabbit? I mean‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs all connected man‚Ä¶ Everything‚Ä¶ You, the universe, the fat kids‚Ä¶ They‚Äôre all connected. You look into the old man‚Äôs eyes and a million questions spring to your lips. You contemplate what to ask. Finally you settle for asking ‚ÄúWhat wisdom
title: Gamer Ooze Side Effects
